meanings.sent1: After finishing his essay, he decided to reedit it for any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to reedit her photos before posting them online.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to reedit their homework, but they accidentally made it worse!
meanings.sent4: Just like a sculptor refining a masterpiece, she carefully reedited her novel until it was perfect.
meanings.sent5: To truly polish your writing, you must be willing to reedit it multiple times.

meanings.sent1: Before submitting his report, he needed to reedit it for any errors.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reedit your work to ensure it is accurate.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he needed to reedit his jokes before the show.
meanings.sent4: She approached the task of reediting the document with precision and care.
meanings.sent5: The editor's job is to meticulously reedit manuscripts for publication.

meanings.definition: To make changes to a document or publication
meanings.sent1: The author had to reedit his book to include new information.
meanings.sent2: They decided to reedit the magazine layout for a more modern look.
meanings.sent3: The team had to reedit the presentation at the last minute due to new data.
meanings.sent4: She had to reedit the brochure to reflect the updated company information.
meanings.sent5: In order to meet the deadline, they had to quickly reedit the final draft.
